contents: Article 13 (Duties of Executive Directors) ① The Chairman represents the Corporation, supervises the affairs, and is responsible for the management performance of the Corporation during his term of office. ② The Executive Director assists the Chairman and performs duties in accordance with the organizational regulations and as determined by the Chairman. ③ Directors attend the Board of Directors meetings to deliberate and decide on important matters of the Corporation. ④ Auditors audit the corporation's accounting, business execution status, and asset status and submit their opinions to the Board of Directors, thereby ensuring the corporation's interests. In matters where the interests of the Chairman and the Chairman are conflicting, the Corporation is represented., ⑤ If the Chairman is unable to perform his/her duties due to unavoidable reasons, he/she shall act on behalf of the Chairman in the following order., 1. Among the standing directors, the Chairman shall Person appointed in advance, 2. Planning director, pension director, welfare director, fund director, 3. Non-executive director appointed by the Minister of Health and Welfare
